elements.description:
`calendar-element`

A polyfill date picker using Polymer.

If you like to connect it to an input, try it like:

  ```html
    <input type="date" value="{{date::input}}">

    <calendar-element date="{{date}}"></calendar-element>
  ```

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--datetime-background` | text-color of the time-element | `#252525`
`--datetime-color` | text-color of the time-element | `#ccc`
`--datetime-selected-background` | background-color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `--primary-color, #253EEC`
`--datetime-selected-color` | color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `#f1f1f1`
`--datetime-element` | Mixin applied to the time-element and the calender-element | `{}`
`--datetime-input` | Mixin applied to the inputs | {border-radius: 2px; padding: 0.35em; border: none; outline: none; text-align: center; box-sizing: content-box; background-color: transparent; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1);}`
`--datetime-icon` | Mixin applied to closing icon | `{padding: 8px; height: 16px; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1); fill: currentColor;}`

properties.name: opened
properties.description: true if the element is opened

properties.name: closable
properties.description: true if the element is closable (then an icon is shown)

properties.name: locale
properties.description: The current locale

properties.name: viewDate
properties.description: The date of the view of the month and year

params.name: viewDate
params.description: The value of the date of the current view.

elements.name: CalendarElement

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: true if the element is opened

attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: true if the element is closable (then an icon is shown)

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The current locale

attributes.name: view-date
attributes.description: The date of the view of the month and year

elements.description:
`time-element`

A polyfill time picker using Polymer.

If you like to connect it to an input, try it like:

  ```html
    <input type="time" value="{{time::input}}" step="1">

    <time-element time="{{time}}"></time-element>
  ```

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--datetime-background` | text-color of the time-element | `#252525`
`--datetime-color` | text-color of the time-element | `#ccc`
`--datetime-selected-background` | background-color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `--primary-color, #253EEC`
`--datetime-selected-color` | color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `#f1f1f1`
`--datetime-element` | Mixin applied to the time-element and the calender-element | `{}`
`--datetime-input` | Mixin applied to the inputs | {border-radius: 2px; padding: 0.35em; border: none; outline: none; text-align: center; box-sizing: content-box; background-color: transparent; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1);}`
`--datetime-icon` | Mixin applied to closing icon | `{padding: 8px; height: 16px; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1); fill: currentColor;}`

properties.name: opened
properties.description: true if the element is opened

properties.name: closable
properties.description: true if the element is closable (then an icon is shown)

elements.name: TimeElement

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: true if the element is opened

attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: true if the element is closable (then an icon is shown)

elements.description:
`datetime-picker` is a picker for date and time for **[Polymer](https://github.com/Polymer/polymer)** that prefers to use the native input. This element is for using the *native* date-picker, if it exists, or to replace it by a CustomElement. The `calendar-element` and the `time-element` will just be used if the native picker is not available or is explicitly wanted.

  ```html
  <datetime-picker value="{{value}}"></datetime-picker>
  ```

  If you need an **overlay** then use `overlay-datetime-picker`, what extends `datetime-picker` and create the polyfilled elements `time-element` and `calendar-element` in an `overlay-element`, that extends *IronOverlayBehavior* and will create some of its attribute-bindings.


  Custom property | Description | Default
  ----------------|-------------|----------
  `--datetime-background` | text-color of the time-element | `#252525`
  `--datetime-color` | text-color of the time-element | `#ccc`
  `--datetime-selected-background` | background-color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `--primary-color, #253EEC`
  `--datetime-selected-color` | color of the focussed time-input and the hovered icons | `#f1f1f1`
  `--datetime-element` | Mixin applied to the time-element and the calender-element | `{}`
  `--datetime-input` | Mixin applied to the inputs | {border-radius: 2px; padding: 0.35em; border: none; outline: none; text-align: center; box-sizing: content-box; background-color: transparent; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1);}`
  `--datetime-icon` | Mixin applied to closing icon | `{padding: 8px; height: 16px; transition: background-color 150ms cubic-bezier(0.6, 1, 0.2, 1); fill: currentColor;}`
  `--datetime-native-input` | Mixin applied to the native inputs of the datetime-picker| `{}`

properties.name: useNotNative
properties.description: Force to not use the native input, even if it exists

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input elements

properties.name: calendarOpened
properties.description: true if the date-picker is opened

properties.name: timeOpened
properties.description: true if the time-picker is opened

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

elements.name: DatetimePicker

attributes.name: use-not-native
attributes.description: Force to not use the native input, even if it exists

attributes.name: horizontal-align
attributes.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

attributes.name: vertical-align
attributes.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: disables the input elements

attributes.name: calendar-opened
attributes.description: true if the date-picker is opened

attributes.name: time-opened
attributes.description: true if the time-picker is opened

attributes.name: no-cancel-on-esc-key
attributes.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

elements.description:
`overlay-element`
A helper-element, that creates an overlay using iron-overlay-behavior of Polymer.
elements.name: OverlayElement

elements.description:
`overlay-datetime-picker` extends `datetime-picker` and create the polyfilled elements `time-element` and `calendar-element` in an `overlay-element`, that extends *IronOverlayBehavior* and will create some of its attribute-bindings. *IronOverlayBehavior* itself extends also *IronFitBehavior* and *IronResizableBehavior*. Styling the overlay is currently not possible.

  ```html
  <overlay-datetime-picker value="{{value}}" use-not-native></overlay-datetime-picker>
  ```

properties.name: useNotNative
properties.description: Force to not use the native input, even if it exists

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input elements

properties.name: calendarOpened
properties.description: true if the date-picker is opened

properties.name: timeOpened
properties.description: true if the time-picker is opened

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

classes.description:
Mixin that provides for text inputs a numeric behavior and for buttons tap and hold behavior

A switch needs a `for`-tag, to connect in to the according input, and a `step`-tag to show, how to increment the value
